p: The study was conducted from January–April 2014 in the Scalesia forest near ‘Los Gemelos’ in the humid highlands of Santa Cruz Island (0°37′34″ S, 90°23′10″ W; 500–600 m a.s.l., Fig. 1). The forest is dominated by the endemic tree species Scalesia pedunculata (Asteraceae) but has been invaded by several introduced plant species, predominantly by R. niveus Thunb. (blackberry, Rosaceae), Tradescantia fluminensis Vell. (wandering jew, Commelinaceae), Cestrum auriculatum L’Hér. (sauco, Solanaceae) and Piper peltatum L. (Piperaceae).
